page.title: 04DALLINGTON CHURCH
page.content: The Dallington Church is called ST.Giles.It stands about 200 yards from the windmill.The Dallington district is a deanery,probably the oldest and is consequently the mother church of the neighbourhood.The oldest part of the church is its rare steeple.Only 3 other churches have one in sussex.In the 12th century the church of ST.Margaret at Dallington was mentioned in a Hastings Priory Charter. It was rebuilt by Sir Thomas Hope in the 14th century.One of the merlons on the tower has a plain cross on a shield and ST.Margaret always carried a cross to defeat the devil. The suggestteddate of the tower and spire is 1470. Thepresent church was probably built by the Pelham family during the 15th century the Pelham Buckle can be seen on the two outermost merlons of the tower.
